title: New: Palmistry – Shrimps Last Dance
body: **[Palmistry](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/16440-exclusive-premiere-palmistry-i-swear-fai-sai/ "Exclusive Premiere: Palmistry – I Swear Mixtape")** has been a friend of the site for a little while now, we dropped his last mixtape, [I Swear](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/16440-exclusive-premiere-palmistry-i-swear-fai-sai/ "Exclusive Premiere: Palmistry – I Swear Mixtape"), exclusively earlier this year and he later played [Brainchild Festival](http://admin.crackintheroad.com/music/16056-announcement-crack-in-the-road-x-brainchild-festival/ "Announcement: Crack in the Road X Brainchild Festival"), the festival we collaborate with. After that, the boy dropped off the face of the earth. Like completely, leaving me a bit scared that he’d stopped making music. It’s a mixture of happiness and relief then that I present his new EP, _Shrimps Last Dance_, a remarkably more stripped affair in compression to his earlier work. Here, the focus is almost exclusively on jams. There’s a heart-breaking undertone to it all too, the whole thing seems thrown together, chucked out and premature. But it’s these elements that are the records greatest strength: it feels like a compulsion rather than a decision.
